game_description: You play as a mage, who is trapped on the verge of the logical and the magical. Learn how to find hidden chests, unlock and use your magical abilities to search for the way out of these amusing and enchanted ancient rooms, caves, and labyrinths. Cast magic at certain places and prepare for the unexpected metamorphosis. Open pathways with fun-to-solve puzzles, and defeat creatures in this relaxing fantasy adventure. Go for the adventure alone or gather company (LAN-multiplayer) to uncover the secrets of Zephyrus! Dungeon crawler on the 'The Dark River Ruins' level of adventurous fun with magic mixed in. Seven unique character designs and countless curses. Localization in 12 languages. A big old dice in order to teleport to certain areas. "Witches, Switches... flying cats!" This game can also be played in single mode and cooperative multiplayer mode on a local network (LAN/Wifi). Comfort Options: Snap Turn, Teleport, Comfort Tunneling (optional), Head-based locomotion. Comfort levels will vary for every player, and prolonged use can sometimes cause motion sickness and eye strain. review_1: There's definitely some big potential here. Loved the light dynamics and feel of the dungeon navigation. That said, it needs a lot of polish in its current state. The tutorial did a decent job, but the game objectives and menu navigation were really unclear after that point. The "warp" effect that completely blocks your vision when running into a wall felt super weird. Perhaps "ghosting" the actual map terrain with a translucent portal overlay could achieve a similar design while not completely removing the ability to keep track of your body in space. The teleporting felt extremely sluggish. Would much prefer an aim indicator showing where the dice is going to go, and then an immediate teleport to that spot (e.g. A Township Tale). These types of games often require some level of reflexes when dealing with enemies, so clunky movement can really ruin the experience. All in all, wish the developers the best of luck! Definitely some promise here if the kinks are ironed out.
review_2: I tried a few games recently. Zephyrus seems promising indeed in its fantasy world. Substantial gameplay combined with great visuality. The Demo hint at some great features of the Zephyrus Prelude which I'm curious to try.

review_5: Played on Quest 1. When I first played this game (demo) I actually did not know what to do. But i continued to try, and after a while i (guess) discovered how things worked. Great to see things change after achievements. Great small discoveries to be made. Perfect for a free (demo) game. I am curious how the full game will become. So, here's 5 stars
